climbs.name: Zesty Testes
climbs.fa: June 2019 - Samuel Johnson and Ian Colegrove

content.protection: Trad. Bolted belays. 70m half ropes recommended. You may want cordelette and rap rings depending on your taste. Scramble to the top of the tower or just rappel. Each station has at least a single rap ring currently.
content.location: Zesty Testes is the blue route in this photo, climbing the right side of the 3 pitch arete feature. Locate tower visually. From the East side of Thumb cove, walk up one of several rocky drainages with minimal brush past a large waterfall to the base of the tower. Scramble up a 30m slab to the base of the arete just left of a brushy dihedral (Trad belay).

climbs.name: Liquid Potatoes
climbs.fa: June 2019 - Ian Colegrove and Samuel Johnson

content.protection: Trad. 1 protection bolt on pitch 2 and 1 protection bolt on pitch 3. Mixed gear and bolt belays.  70m half ropes recommended. You may want cordelette and rap rings per your personal taste as some stations are set up for single bolt rappels with backup bolt or gear.
content.location: From the East side of Thumb cove, visually locate the tower. Follow one of several large rocky drainages up and right past a large waterfall and cliffs. Scramble a 30m slab to the beginning of the route, about 50 feet right of the arete at the base of Zesty Testes.

climbs.name: Going Commando
climbs.fa: September 2018 - Samuel Johnson and Ian Colegrove

content.description: P1 - 5.7: Traditionally protected slab with occasional gear in overlaps and left facing corner. If the corner is wet, move left and wander up the slab to its side. 65m. 2 bolt belay.P2 - 5.8+ R: Traditionally protected slab climbs up past a large runout on good holds (1 bolt) and then trends left under a large roof, with gear in the overlap. 55m. 2 bolt belay.P3 - 5.10-  PG13: Find a large cam placement and make a committing move past the left edge of the roof to the right onto a slab. Clip a bolt and then run it out up a steep wall of perfect incut holds to an overlap with opportunity for small gear. 35m. 2 bolt belay.P4 - 5.8+/9-: Fire directly for the top of the cliff on great incut holds. 60m. 2 bolt belay.If you wish, scramble to the top of the tower and walk off right or just rap the route, 4 bolted belays with rap rings.
content.protection: Trad. Spaced gear a la grit style. 70m ropes required, half ropes recommended. 1 protection bolt on pitch two and one on pitch three to prevent an R rating for subsequent ascents. Bolted belays with rap rings.
content.location: Approach waterfall tower as per area instructions.Scramble up a 30m slab to a ring bolt at the base of the first pitch just left of the prominent dihedral. Routeline is in red in the picture.

content.description: Waterfall Tower is a prominent 800 foot basalt formation on the East side of Thumb Cove.So far, there are three 3-4 pitch developed routes of generally high quality basalt face climbing featuring every shape of climbing hold. The climbing tends toward the technical rather than the pumpy due to the extremely high friction of the rock, the three dimensionality of the pillow basalt, and a wide variety of hold shapes and sizes. They all have dirty sounding names that came from very innocuous camp situations, like drinking mashed potatoes or not wearing underpants.The climbs are almost exclusively traditional, and gear is generally spaced a la grit style. If you are a 5.8 leader you will not like leading the 5.8, but if you are a 5.10 leader you will probably feel OK on the 5.8 and the 5.10 pitches.Recommended rack is a double rack of cams 0.1" to 3," single 4" cam, single set of nuts, single set of offset nuts +/or brassies. Many placements feature a slight flare, so subbing out one set of small standard cams for offset cams will add some measure of mental happiness for the leader and mean more placement options overall, making the routes less sparsely protected.
